TopicTitle: Can I move the mods folder to another to another hard drive?

Articles.Content:
Basically, in my computer, I have two drives, my computer drive, (Which holds only 118 GB) and a data drive. Is it possible to move the gamedata folder to the data drive, and still have the game work?
Fire

Edited December 8, 2017 by Firemetal

No, GameData has to be in the KSP directory (like everything else KSP-related).

You could try moving your entire KSP install to the data drive, though I'm not sure if you can run it from there.
You can't separate the gamedata folder from the KSP directory (as far as I know) but you can move the entire directory wherever you like. You can run it from a USB drive if you want to :).

Actually, if you are familiar with symbolic links, you can move stuff out of GameData, and replace it with a link that points to its new home (on Windows at least).  I do this to keep all of my in-development mods synched into my live development KSP install.  The repositories are located on a separate hard-drive from the KSP install, and only symbolic links are present in GameData pointing to the actual locations.

The CMD for this is (must be run as administrator)

mklink /d <link> <targetPath>

Edit:  I have no idea if this can be applied to the entire GameData folder.  Maybe... maybe not.  In theory it should work, but I have not tried it in practice.
